snippet: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, said that troubled countries had made “significant progress” remaking their economies.
abstract: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi gives guardedly upbeat assessment of the state of the euro zone, saying that troubled countries have made significant progress in remaking their economies and that the banking system is healthier.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Paris and Melissa Eddy reported from Berlin. Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid, and Stephen Castle from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, said that troubled countries had made “significant progress” remaking their economies.

headline.main: Optimism From Draghi on the Financial Health of Europe
headline.print_headline: Optimism From European Central Bank Head on the Financial Health of the Region
